SEARCH
Module com.example.appproject
Package com.example.appproject

Class Cursor

java.lang.Object
com.example.appproject.Cursor
public class Cursor extends Object
The Cursor Class contains the attributes used to describe a Cursor (drawing pen) and the methods used in the Interpreter Class to execute the user's instructions.

    Field

  • Field Details

    • positionX

      int positionX
      The coordinate on the abscissa axis.

    • positionY

      int positionY
      The coordinate on the ordinate axis.

    • direction

      float direction
      The attribute representing the angle, in degrees from the abscissa, pointed by the cursor

    • id

      int id
      The id used in the Class MapCursor as a Key.

    • thickness

      double thickness
      The attribute representing the length of the trail traced by the cursor.

    • opacity

      double opacity
      The intensity of the marking leaved by the cursor.

    • visible

      boolean visible
      The attribute representing the visibility by the user of the cursor. If true, the cursor is appearing in the drawing area interface.

    • color

      Colorj color
      The Colorj object representing the color of the cursor and the color of the trail. The color can be determined with multiple formats, web or rgb.

    • Cursor

      public Cursor(int id)
      This constructor method creates a cursor with preset attributes
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the cursor used as a Key in MapCursor Objects.

  • Method Details

    • duplicate

      public void duplicate(Cursor modelCursor)
      Changes the attributes of this cursor to copy those of modelCursor.
      Parameters:
      modelCursor -

    • position

      public void position(int positionX, int positionY)
      The position method is used to implement the POS instruction and MOV instruction. When POS is called the position method is used, but when MOV is called a lign is drawn between the last position and the new one.
      Parameters:
      positionX -
      positionY -

    • position

      public void position(Percentage per_x, Percentage per_y, int dimensionX, int dimensionY)
      The POS and MOV methods can be used with percentages of the dimensions of the canvas. per_x and per_y are Percentage objects which ensure that their value is between 0 and 1.
      Parameters:
      per_x - Position X on the abscissa in percentage of the width of the canvas.
      per_y - Position Y on the ordinate in percentage of the height of the canvas.
      dimensionX - Width of the canvas.
      dimensionY - Height of the canvas.

    • forward

      public void forward(int distance)
      The forward method move the cursor by "distance" pixels, following the direction the cursor is headed on, which is the "direction" angle from the abscissa.
      Parameters:
      distance -

    • forward

      public void forward(Percentage value, int dimension)
      Unused : A method to move the cursor forward, the distance travelled is determined by the percentage of the dimension.
      Parameters:
      value - As the "distance" attribute but based of a percentage of the dimension of the canvas.
      dimension - The dimension linked to the canvas from which we want the percentage value to be related to.

    • backward

      public void backward(int value)
      As Forward but the distance entered is the opposite.
      Parameters:
      value -

    • backward

      public void backward(Percentage value, int dimension)

    • turn

      public void turn(double angle)
      Turn the cursor by "angle" degrees, rotating clock-wise. The direction is supposed to be in degrees, between 0 and 359, the setDirection method assures that it is the case. The angle is converted to a float value so the remainder operator % can handle it in setDirection method.
      Parameters:
      angle -

    • lookAt

      public void lookAt(int lookAt_x, int lookAt_y)
      The lookat method turns the cursor so it points to the wanted position.
      Parameters:
      lookAt_x -
      lookAt_y -

      public void lookAt(Cursor modelCursor) throws IllegalArgumentException

      Parameters:
      modelCursor - The cursor to point at.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

      per_y -

    • createMirrorAxis

      public Cursor createMirrorAxis(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, MapCursor cursors) throws OutOfPositionException, NumberFormatException
      Creates a new cursor symmetrical to the selected cursor by the symmetrical axis containing the points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
      Parameters:
      x1 -
      y1 -
      x2 -
      y2 -
      cursors -
      Returns:
      A new Cursor symmetrical to the selected cursor (this)
      Throws:
      OutOfPositionException
      NumberFormatException
